messages.subject: RECONFIRM.Ellie Borden
messages.body:
FROM THE DESK OF BEN UBA(Ph.d). 
SENIOR ACCOUNTANT,LION BANK OF NIGERIA PLC
34 AHMADU BELLO WAY JOS NIGERIA


I am a senior Accountant in my Bank and Accounting officer to Mr.Arthur Borden,who worked as an expatriate well Engineer with Elf petroleum (Nigeria) Ltd. On the 21st of April 2002, my customer, his wife and their two children were involved in auto-crash along the ever busy Sagumu-Ibadan High Way. All occupants of the vehicle unfortunately lost their lives. 

Since then,the Board of Directors of my Bank have made several enquires to their embassy to locate any of my customer's extended relations but to no avail. 

I have contacted you to assist  in repatriating the money and Property left behind by my client before they get Confiscated or declared unserviceable by the bank where this Huge deposits of USD$10M was lodged. 

The Bank has published several Notice for the Next of Kin of the deceased to apply for collection of this Funds or have the account confiscated within a shot Period of time. 

Since I have been unsuccessful in locating the relatives for over 2 years now I seek your consent to present you as the Next of kin of the deceased, so that the proceeds of this Account valued at US$10 million dollars can be paid to you and Then you and me can share the money,60% to me and 40% to you. 

I have all necessary legal documents that can be used to backup any claim we may make. All I require is your honest cooperation to enable this deal through.I guarantee that this will be executed under a legitimate Arrangement that will protect you from any breach of the Law. 

Please get in touch with me via my  email and send to me your Telephone and fax numbers to enable us further about this Transaction. 

Best regards, 

BEN UBA,
SENIOR ACCOUNTANT
LION BANK.

Ben Uba

messages.body:
Mr. Uba,

I never even knew I had a relative named Arthur. This is amazing. I do have a question though, why would I split this money with you 40/60? I suppose I should be grateful for your bringing this inheritance to my attention, but this offer of splitting it in this manner seems inappropriate to me.

Don't you think that it would be more appropriate that we do a 90/10? I would think this would be a more than generous reward for bringing this  inheritance to my attention. And I certainly do appreciate your bringing this to my attention.

Please tell me, what is the next step I should take? Do I contact the bank directly and ask for the money?

Lizzie

messages.subject: URGENT REPLY/MY PASSPORT
messages.body:
Attachment:  Passport.jpg
Dear Lizzie,

Thank you very much for your reply and i was realy flattered.I decided to make it 40/60 because of what it has cost me to get you and considering the fact that you might loose everything if i had not contacted you.

Anyway,maybe we should leave how it should be shared for now and work towards successful transfer of the fund after which you will invite me to your country so i can have my own share of it but you must assure me that you will not disappear when it gets to you.

As for what you are to do next,i would like you to reply as soon as you can and inform me if you can come down to Nigeria and apply for the immediate transfer of the fund or if you would prefer the services of an attorney who will do it on your behalf so i can get you one.

Meanwhile i attached a copy of  my passport and would like you to attach yours too in your next mail.(Please if you did not recieve my passport let me know so i can send it again)

THANKS.

BEN UBA.

Mr. Daneze,

I simply do not understand your attitude. You are the one who was shouting at me, and accusing me. I have been so upset about this whole thing that I developed a migraine headache and have had to miss two whole knitting bee meetings, and stay in my apartment in the dark.  You have made me very nervous and upset.

I don't see how I miscalculated,  though I accept that you are only asking for $2,200 right now. Since you insisted in three separate emails that I explain how I arrived at the figure, here is an explanation.

From your original email:

POLICE REPORT ON THE DEATH $200.USD
ROAD SAFETY REPORT $200.USD
DEATH CERTIFICATE $350.USD
AN AFFIDAVITT THAT YOU ARE THE NEXT OF KIN $150.USD
TOTAL Fees $900.USD
Attorney Fees $4600
Mobilize Fee $1300
Upfront payment $900
Total money $2200

This is 200+200+350+150+900+4600+1300+900+2200 = 10,800.

I am very confused by this whole thing and I can't afford $10,800. I live on social security and don't have that kind of money. Even $2,200 is difficult for  me.

You seem to be a person that is very easily angered and takes their anger out on others. I am very upset. My heart can not take this stress.

Lizzie

Mr. Daneze,

I have been so upset about this whole thing that I developed a migraine headache and have had to miss two whole knitting bee meetings, and stay in my apartment in the dark. You have made me very nervous and upset.

I don't see how I miscalculated, though I accept that you are only asking for $2,200 right now. Since you insisted in three separate emails that I explain how I arrived at the figure, here is an explanation.

From your original email:

POLICE REPORT ON THE DEATH $200.USD
ROAD SAFETY REPORT $200.USD
DEATH CERTIFICATE $350.USD
AN AFFIDAVITT THAT YOU ARE THE NEXT OF KIN $150.USD
TOTAL Fees $900.USD
Attorney Fees $4600
Mobilize Fee $1300
Upfront payment $900
Total money $2200

This is 200+200+350+150+900+4600+1300+900+2200 = 10,800.

I am very confused by this whole thing and I can't afford $10,800. I live on social security and don't have that kind of money. Even $2,200 is difficult for me.

You seem to be a person that is very easily angered and takes their anger out on others. I am very upset. My heart can not take this stress.

Lizzie

[Scam-o-note: dear non-American readers, a short reality check here: for your information, social security in the U.S.A. is a nice supplement to a retirement, but actually trying to live on it is very, very, very tough. It often forces choices between food and medicine and rent. The sidewalks do, however, go all the way up to the doors. But they are not paved with gold.]

messages.body:
The Tale of the Worn Out Balls 



Mr. Daneze,

Well, I may not understand everything, but I do understand that you want $2,200.

To be very frank, i have been dreading this. I can not get to the bank right now. Let me explain this embarrassing situation.

My walker has tennis balls attached to the front legs to keep from scratching the floor. These tennis balls have worn through, and are not working any more. The front entry way of the retirement home where I live has hardwood flooring, and they won't let me go across this floor without my balls.  They always send me back. So, I need to find someplace to get new balls before I can leave to go arrange for the payment. But they don't sell balls in the garden shop here at the home, so I don't know how to get out of the home to buy new ones.  Kind of a chicken and egg problem, if you know what I mean.

You can see why I am embarrassed by this...

So I am working on it. I thought of buying some balls on the internet, but they would take a couple of days to ship here. I may have to do that.

Lizzie

I did get your message on the message machine, but it was very, very hard to understand.

Lizzie

messages.body:
The Tale of the Feral Cat 




Mr. Daneze,

Yes, I have my new balls installed, and they are most satisfactory. If you ever need balls, I can recommend these to you.

I have just returned from the hospital. I did leave to go to the bank but had a little mishap.

Muriel and I had just made it over the shiny hardwood floor and through the front door of the home. As we crossed the old, grey sidewalk to Muriel's car, a marmalade colored feral cat ran out from the bushes and ran between my legs. It was being chased by a small grey marsupial of some sort, perhaps a possum.  Muriel's walker caught in a crack of the sidewalk and we both went down in a tangle of arms and legs. It would have been funny if Muriel had not bruised her hip, and I landed on the possum with a sound somewhere between a squish and a grunt. 

Muriel is still in the hospital. The possum is dead, and the feral cat is missing. Good riddance I say.

Well, of course, the upshot of the whole experience is that I was unable to get to the bank. I will have Maude take me on Monday.
messages.raw:
The Tale of the Feral Cat

Ellie Borden

Date: 5/29/2005

messages.body:
Why do you keep sending your messages twice?

And you are shouting, now, too.

I am very stressed and upset by all of this. I almost broke a hip when that feral cat tipped us over, and I have been working hard to satisfy you, but it appears there is just no satisfaction to be had in your life. You must be a very unhappy man.

The passport is my daughter's, as I explained before, I don't have one. Did you want to speak to her? We call her Beth. She no longer lives in this area, but with email, we keep in touch.

I have not been using my ear muffs recently, they were too sticky. But with all this stress, I think I will lock the door, turn out the lights and have a lie down with the muffs on anyway. Beth told me about this new kind of machine they have that sounds like water running when you turn it on.  It is supposed to make you feel relaxed. I got one and it was most interesting, and was nice. But I found that I had to keep  getting up to go to the bathroom, so I turned it off.

I don't know what you mean by western union, I don't bank at western union. I bank at Compass Savings.

Such anger in the world. Lagos must be a very unpleasant place.

Lizzie

The Tale of the Road Kill Casserole

I did what you asked, and literally begged the lawyer not to quit. In response, he called me rude and stupid. I have not felt so terrible since the raccoon invaded my apartment. He has been such a bad man, to call me names when I never did him any harm.

You know, you and the lawyer seem to be speaking with the same sense of hostility and bitterness. You must be very unhappy people. Maybe it comes from poverty. Maybe just from stupidity. Or even so, perhaps you were bitten by a rabid rodent and are insane?

Yet, somehow, your writing and that of this Mr. Ezendad appear to be so, so similar.  In fact, it might lead one to believe that you are in fact... THE SAME PERSON! Oh my gosh... what a thought.

So, perhaps that might lead me to conclude that there is no money... and you are not actually Mr. Elubad, or Mr. Adenze...

So, you appear to have wasted your time trying to scam a poor old lady that died in 1927...

So long, and thanks for all the fish!

Lizzie
